intro: Chadsia majungensis, commonly known as the Chad sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Chad and neighboring countries. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with limited water availability. Chadsia majungensis plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local fauna.
